website_summaries.verdict: The Nintendo Switch is their most popular console, and it’s easy to see why: it’s just as fun as a portable gaming system as it is when hooked up to a TV.
pros: Nintendo Switch games like Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Smash Bros
Ultimate are so engaging, they’re in a class of their own
It’s the first home console that’s also a portable gaming system
cons: It’s expensive, and so are the games and accessories
It has fewer titles than other platforms do

customer_reviews.title: Will not power on
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Nintendo switch on June 26 and it worked fine up until last week. It will no longer turn on. Docked it in the console, tried the charger directly into the device and nothing. It will not turn on at all. Not happy with this at all. $300 product and works less then 90 days. Very poor
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: WORKED JUST LONG ENOUGH TO BE TOO LATE TO GET MY MONEY BACK
customer_reviews.text: Got the switch for my sons 6th bday in feb 2018 and by June 2018 the screen for the switch had multiple translucent layers showing previous screens all at once making it impossible to play as a handheld. Of course my 6 year old never said anything and it works fine on the TV so I never noticed. So I’m out 300 for a Nintendo paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: B Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Joy Con Drift Issues and Bad Support
customer_reviews.text: The JoyCon drift issues are wayyyy too common. They are a known defect and nothing has been done to change it. There is no way to set up repairs for this online so you have to call and wait on the phone forever and listen to the terrible waiting system. The online system will also be a joke once it comes out. I feel like a sucker right now waiting on the damn support line, especially since I'll know this will be repeat issue.
customer_reviews.author: J R R

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer now!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would like this console as much as I do. I have to admit, I only bought it on a whim because it was rare to find one in stock, and Amazon just so happened to have them. Now I'm all about the Switch. Let's talk about the hardware, since that's what this review will go under. I think it's a reasonable price. It's really well thought out. The controllers are very unique. I bought an extra 2-pack, so I can do 4-player Tetris and Mario Kart. I wish the price of the controllers and accessories was less. Overall, it feels great, and it's a joy seeing amazing graphics in a portable system.
customer_reviews.author: Hsayy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I cant even express how disappointed I am with this product, It is currently on its 3rd return for not working now it doesn't charge, 3 months ago couldn't read the card, and 3 months before that same thing,, I think in total if has actually been played with a total of 30 HOURS Nintendo charged me 99 dollars last time saying it had "water damage" well since no one plays with it other then on trips IDK how that happened , I think this is the most expensive POS I have every owned,, from Wii to Nintendo game consoles I have brought them all over the past 40 years but this sucks
customer_reviews.author: Mary Martelloni

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Switch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 100% Nintendo’s best console yet! It’s the Wii U’s comeback. Returning games like splatoon 2 and new games like ARMS! I basically have every big switch game and I’m not disappointed in any of the games! Hardware is great it doesn’t feel toy ish like the Wii U did! It feels great in the hands! The joy cons are very sturdy! i would recommend the pro controller, buttons on it are a lot bigger and feels more natural! I 1000% recommend the switch there are so many games to come! I’m hoping for Smash Bros Switch and some kind of Pokémon game!
customer_reviews.author: Carrot

customer_reviews.title: It breaks just after warranty expires.
customer_reviews.text: 1 week after the warranty expired it turned off and will no longer turn on. Just black screen. Won't charge. Nothing. 300 dollar useless paperweight. I just think it's kind of suspicious that it only lasts as long as the warranty. It wasn't even heavily used.
customer_reviews.author: LunaLightfoot

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM eCLOSEOUTS
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Nintendo Switch from eCLOSEOUTS and it DID NOT COME WITH A NINTENDO SWITCH DOCK!!! DO NOT BUY FROM THEM!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrés Coronado

customer_reviews.title: & I'm happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, was worried about ordering this. Didn't know if it was going to be worth it and didn't know if it would survive the trip. But it did, & I'm happy with this purchase. I'm glad I took a chance. This is what I'll be gaming on from now on most of the time. I do recommended getting a screen protector to avoid scratches and whatnot & also a protective case if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SCAM - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After the release of the 2019 Nintendo Switch, and during quarantine, bots were used to purchase any remaining stock in stores and warehouses. The Switches sold on Amazon and EBay are NOT new. These used consoles are over priced to make profit. Be aware when purchasing consoles on third-party sites. I received a scratched up console that didn't even come in the original packaging.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Charging after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the current price gouging, the console stopped charging after a year. That's an expensive disposable game. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: RedDad

customer_reviews.title: Permanently banned
customer_reviews.text: I got the product and attempted to use it but was met with this error. This error say it is permanently banned from connecting the the Nintendo network and e-shop
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Does Not Honor Warranty
customer_reviews.text: My son used this unit for 7 months. At which time the unit stopped powering up. There was no physical damage to the device. Sent to Nintendo to have repaired, still well under warranty. Nintendo responded that they would not repair under warranty, but gave no explanation. Should give this zero stars. I have been buying electronics and computer gadgets for more than 30 years, and never had anything this expensive (relative to its function) break so quickly, and not be supported by the manufacturer. Beware, Nintendo makes garbage, and they will not warranty the garbage that they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Westcott

customer_reviews.title: NOT UPDATED (neon red/blue)
customer_reviews.text: BE WARNED! This is NOT the new version 2 updated one in neon red/blue. Not sure what the other reviewers are talking about. They might be confused. I received the old one with the white box, even though the description shows the red (updated) box for both the gray and the neon red/blue versions. Hopefully my reviews saves people the headache of ordering the wrong one. Guess we gotta wait until the update the entire listing to the new one like they did for the grey.
customer_reviews.author: Lukasz

customer_reviews.title: 2010 called they want their gaming console back
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of trash: 1. Bad graphics 2. Slow 3. 32gb of storage 4. Horrible battery life 5. You have to buy many SD cards to play many of the games $$$$$ 6. It comes with two tiny controllers and no regular size ones 7. Slow slow slow downloads from Nintendo server 8. Overpriced console 9. Games are Overpriced 10. Horrible refresher rate If you don’t need Mario games and a portable console then don’t buy this. Xbox or PS4 waaaaaay better for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: JCB

customer_reviews.title: I WANT A NEW SWITCH
customer_reviews.text: I got my switch and I played it for a few weeks heavily. One night, I go to turn it off and the power button won't work. I'm trying everything I can to turn it off and the power button will not work anymore. I can plug it in and play that way, but only mobile. I try to play on my TV and the screen stays on for a few seconds before turning off again till I take it off the dock and connect it to the charger. I feel ripped off. I'm disappointed that Nintendo would release such a flimsy console when all of their previous consoles never had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tricky

customer_reviews.title: Almost new switch had error messages
customer_reviews.text: I got mine used and the quality it said was almost new. When I opened and tried to play, error messages popped up. I ended up calling Nintendo and was on the phone with them for an hour trying to fix it. Long story short, I have to send it into Nintendo to see if they can fix it. However the quality of the switch was in perfect condition. There was nothing broken or scratch on it at all. My major complaint is the huge error message that prevented me from playing
customer_reviews.author: Ivie Gordon

customer_reviews.title: It's...Nintendo.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best console I own. HOWEVER; it's cheaply made, ports of games as old as 2014 are either still full price or more expensive than they were when they first came out, alot of the games on the marketplace are mobile games ported to the switch. My joycons failed after 2 months. This quickly went from my favorite system to my least used because Nintendo acts like GameStop when it comes to pricing. I'll spend $60 on a new game any day, but if you're going to charge me the same amount for something that came out last gen? No.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Base is broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and honestly never really used. I've played it 3 times since I bought it. After the second time, the dock stopped working. It wouldn't charge the switch anymore or power it on. You can, however, still charge the switch by plugging the power directly into it. This is a serious inconvenience though, as I can't play the damn thing on my TV! Was really disappointed by this. Less than 3 plays and I already have to buy a new accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy company will send you a Nintendo switch that was refurbished and charge you $245 fee to restock it but not honor that it was faulty The one I bought had issues with the memory card, to where it was getting hot in the area with the card in it.
customer_reviews.author: John fisher

customer_reviews.title: Poor controller quality.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me a Switch on Black Friday. I pretty much finished Zelda and now playing Skyrim. The joysticks on the controller have started to drift so my player will look up for no reason, or starts running. This really makes game play hard. I have tried to recalibrate the joysticks and even rolled them back to original condition. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KMC

customer_reviews.title: More Digital Junk
customer_reviews.text: We bought this console expecting it to maybe have one basic game so it can be played out of the box, but that is not the case. in order to actually use a 300$-machine you have to buy more from the digital ether in order to make it work. I would like to return it, but I cannot find anywhere on the order that will let me send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Megan A. Mazzocco

customer_reviews.title: A refurbished Nintendo Switch is not worth $400
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on title alone and was surprised when it came and was refurbished. Maybe put it in the title that this is refurbished to avoid reviews like this. A refurbished switch is not worth $400+

customer_reviews.title: I want the Switch back Chris.
customer_reviews.text: I think about the Switch daily. I miss it more than I’ll ever miss my ex. Should have been petty and taken it back from him. I know things shouldn’t be fought over, but the Switch is a gaming system you maybe should put a little fight for. Dump him, not your Switch baby. I will get back in my feet and buy another once we have jobs again after this pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara Birley

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY USED!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the switch for my daughter and when I went to set it up I couldn't get online. I called Nintendo and they said the console was permanently banned for illegal use.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Non-gamer, loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer, I got this ostensibly for the kids entertainment over the holidays. I set it up and tested it using Mario Kart, with steering wheel (sold separately, you should spring for it) and it was a total blast! I bought about five other games and am waiting for the holidays to be over so I can play them in peace. Nintendo switch is very user-friendly and Mario Kart is a great starter game to get with it, especially if you are not into this whole scene.
customer_reviews.author: Irish4TW

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: Switch was a European version and seller did not let me know. Also would not take a return after multiple requests.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: For being out of stock, I had it ON the day it said to be delivered. Box was clean and well packaged, and it all worked and came as advertised. I'm so happy with it too, buy Zelda and enjoy hours of play. I havnt had one problem with this.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo won me back
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a Nintendo console, since the days of N64, so I was due. I'd seen all the systems come and go, and the next Zelda was always what I was curious about most. Unfortunately, none of them ever drew me back to Nintendo, until Breath of the Wild. My friend made a point of lending me his Switch to give me a hands on look, and I was impressed. And Zelda is an incredible experience. I dig console mode more over handheld mode, but that's slowly changing with a few other games. Overall, it's probably the best Nintendo to ever come out, so I'm wildly impressed with the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Hvisc

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Ninendo deserves to go out of business for making the worst console/hand held of all time. It’s junk. Controllers are almost impossible to use in any consistent way.
customer_reviews.author: James Rickenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: No game, heartbroken six year old
customer_reviews.text: There was no game or download code in this bundle. I paid 560$ specifically to get this game with the switch. After an hour on the phone with nintendo they provided an expired code for the game download. Imagine a six year olds broken heart after doing chores for six weeks to earn this as a reward and it turns out like this.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Rudnicki

customer_reviews.title: Its powerful and fun, despite a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo needs to work on quality control because I'm having issues connecting my left joycon. I was able to find a fix, but I wish these issued were worked out before they started boxing these. Overall, decent console and surprisingly powerful for how small it is, despite the short battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year!  What a ripoff
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on 9/27/18 - by 7/10/19 this Switch got a blue screen and it is now unuseable. This was dropped once during this time; however, worked afterward without a problem. We called Nintendo to fix it under the warranty but because the Switch has a small scratch on the outer case, the warranty is invalidated. We took it to UBreakIFix and but the recommended fix doesn't work. I'm am completely disgusted that at the cost of this product - $299 - that it didn't even last a year. Lesson learned - buy refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Pam MacGray

customer_reviews.title: Cool device but cheap made and horrible customer support.
customer_reviews.text: ive Had the Nintendo for less then a month barely even used it less then 3 hours of use and the left joycon doesn’t lock it slides off by the slightest movement. I called nintendobamd the service was horrible they want me to wait up to 6 weeks for a replacement if that’s even the problem and then another 6 weeks if it was the console. I won’t buy from them again it may have been faulty product but I won’t be going with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: only get this if youre into Nintendo games
customer_reviews.text: If you have a pc, 85% of the library you can get on pc.I'm going to have my steam account a lot long then I'm going to have this. Only get this if you like taking $300 consoles outside of your home only for it to be dropped, like why would I be out with this? If I'm hanging with friends is not going to whip this out and then ignore them? Exclusive is really limited but not enough to justify a purchase unless you're getting this for a kid under 12. Super Smash and BReath of the wild are the only worthwhile titles and 2 games isn't enough to justify buying a console
customer_reviews.author: Alex Zarazua

customer_reviews.title: Switch audio failure
customer_reviews.text: The game system is great but after 2 weeks of use the sound on the system failed on me. The only way to get any sound from the system was by headphones or TV. I didnt even droo or damage the switch either since I bought a protector case for it. Once I get my refund I'll just head to gamestop and get a new switch with their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ytr9677

customer_reviews.title: Great console with minor flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: >>Good and bright enough screen. >>Excelent weight, not too heavy nor light. >>Good materials, doesn't feel cheap. >>Good overall design. >>There're great games and more to come. >>The fan is pretty quiet. >>Almost doesn't heat in portable mode. Cons: >>The distribution of the buttons and stick on the right joy-con makes my hand hurt after playing a few hours. >>The price of some accesories is too high. >>The design of the base/hub scratch the edge of the screen, even if you're carefull enough (buy a screen protector). >>The buttons of the joy-cons seems fragile to me (time will tell). To improve: >>The screen can be bigger with the same size, just reducing the bezel. >>Increase battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Kunkun-kun

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed.
customer_reviews.text: Clever design. When I saw detachable side controllers I figured it would last about three days (we electronic engineers hate connectors of any kind and especially the problems that come from messing them about with constant on and offs!). But these seem to have clever slides to locate them neatly across from opto-couplers. A much cleverer way of doing things. We will see how it lasts but the picture is great, my son loves it, and it appears to do what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great portable system both defective.
customer_reviews.text: This is genius. Being married is easier with a switch. Now she can watch all her tv shows and I can play my video games without her nagging me! I am in my mid 30's and I highly recommend and enjoy the switch. Very nostalgic and fresh. ***Bought 2 off of Amazon first one had a dead pixel second one the edges are light around the screen. I don't know if they sell refurbished ones or I was just unlucky. Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Retro gamer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo overheats and turns off. Joy-con does not work or charges. Also the system came with a dragon sticker on the back with proves that system was refurnished or used.
customer_reviews.author: Happy mom..

customer_reviews.title: Good system but recent internet limits are bad
customer_reviews.text: The system runs perfectly. I'm just disappointed that a month after buying it the company decided that they are going to make you pay to use your own internet. That's a straight up scam and a lazy excuse for charging a monthly/yearly subscription. It would be one thing if they gave it a roaming internet for the expense. But they straight up used to let you use your own internet free and now want you to pay for something you already had? It's like if your laptop decided to charge you to use the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The family loved it So much got a 2nd Nintendo Swich so the we could play without interupting eachother.
customer_reviews.text: So many games I cannot keep up with... We actually ended up getting a 2nd switch because the Wife and Kids kept stealing it from me when I was playing Zelda. ********************************************************************************* MAKE SURE TO MAKE USER PROFILES FOR EVERY USER!!!! ********************************************************************************* We played and bought games only under my profile... When we got the new system we could not have both profiles on 2 systems and no way to copy saves over like with the Playstation 3 and 4... You can move the whole profile but it is removed off the original system when you do that. I lost over 80+ hrs of work on Zelda to keep the wife happy because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Best console that's happened to me
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade from a DS to a Switch. It is such a versatile console that has the graphics and power of a table console in the portability of a handheld. The straight joysticks take a little getting used to, but having the handheld attachment really helps. I was thinking about getting the pro-controller, but found there were plenty of alternate ways to make the controls comfortable. I played all of Breath of the Wild without the pro and it was fine. I have high hopes that the switch will stay relevant for a long time and will be an amazing, portable source of entertainment wherever I go.
customer_reviews.author: EKC

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Bought the switch thinking it was going to have some good mainstream games coming out for it that I could play on the go, but here we are coming on 2019 and nothing really good out yet. Other then that the switch works as advertised but being that there just isn't any interesting game to play on it I cant give more then 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce Magana

customer_reviews.title: One remote stopped working after less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves playing his Switch. He’s a dad now but was a “gamer” in his prime. He’s loved getting back to playing and says this is so much more convenient for popping into a game while still being with the family in the evenings. One issue. We’ve had the system less than a month and he plays on it for an hour or so most nights and one of the remotes stopped working. It registers the wrong buttons when you press. Very disappointing for a device that many give to irresponsible kids to play with. I’m not sure it’s up to the use the way that I remember say Xbox controllers being. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Console!
customer_reviews.text: I love this console. It's amazing that you can play handheld, and also on the tv. It's such an upgrade from the wii U, I never use the wii U tablet unless I have to, I also use a wii remote with it. It's easily portable, and it will be great for me to bring to college with me when I go back since I commute and have a long day with many hours of doing nothing. The only bad thing is that the battery life feels kind of short, but you can play it while it's charging so it's not really an issue. I highly recommend the free Pokemon Quest game as well if you purchase this console.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it July 22 of this year for my husband and already, 4 months later, the left controller has stopped working. Trying to get a replacement via Nintendo has proven to be too much of a hassle. Will simply spend another 70 dollars and buy new controllers. Not happy about that, but hubby loves using the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: The mobile version of the PC Master Race
customer_reviews.text: The best mobile console out there in my opinion. Got this for a 20hr car trip and I don't regret it. This console is worth buying for BOTW alone. I have also been enjoying Pokemon lets go, Smash Ultimate, and Stardew Valley. There is nothing quite like walking around board in a mall then whipping out your switch in the shoe aisle for a quick Smash tournament with friends or siblings. Instant multiplayer anywhere, the mobility, and adaptability make this console an excellent buy. Just make sure you buy a screen protector. Ive heard that the dock has been known to leave marks on the switch's plastic screen
customer_reviews.author: King of Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great for trips.
customer_reviews.text: Generally have only played more direct consoles/pc but purchased the switch after having tried it a few times. Very impressed at the functionality it supports to just pickup and go on the move. I find it great for work trips, great for on the plane. It will only get better once they add more and more games. Overall good bang for your buck system. I would recommend Breath of the Wild or Super Smash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Joy con sucks
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the joy con constantly turns to the left even if I'm not touching it. You would think after years of prime payments and constant orders you'd he taken care of, you would be wrong. I bought this system less than a week ago and its already not working. I'd buy in person If I were anyone reading this reveiw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: The Switch often lags because of the lack of ram. It also runs on 720P when in hand held. It is also too expensive. I did a trade in for credit towards this item and amazon denied my trade in claiming that the item was "cracked". The item I traded in was in perfect condition and I have no idea why amazon denied it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL remote layout
customer_reviews.text: I like the actual system, but it’s extremely frustrating to play because the joystick and buttons are too close together and the home/capture button is right next to where your finger can easily hit it during play. I can’t count how many times we’ve been in the middle of Mario and we end up changing controller settings or going into sleep mode, etc. They should have done like the Wii with the buttons in the middle of the remote.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: It’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I know I bought from a third party seller so I didn’t expect much, but I got the product at least. It came in a pretty well put together package. Everything worked properly, except the joy cons, which is the only way you can actually play anything on the console. They can’t be charged so I have to purchase new ones. This seller still a pretty bad choice if they’re still letting mistakes like this happen
customer_reviews.author: Jahmad K. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas and it had completely stopped working within 4 months. Reading other reviews, this is a common problem. Complete waste of money. Never had this problem with a PlayStation or Xbox. I would recommend staying away from the Switch, and Nintendo in general. I am sure I will. What a piece of overpriced junk.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Concept!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent condition I usually buy locally but I love amazon and don't want to support gamestop and target employees are rude. To the point the console is fun and powerful controllers are odd but you will adapt. Screen is as big as my note 8 thank you for that Nintendo. People have gotten used to larger phones. Excellent game library for kids to adults. So far I love this console/handheld the only improvement I could think of is, a pro controller coming with the cosole better battery life 1080 undocked/docked 60fps.
customer_reviews.author: William Ruvalcaba

customer_reviews.title: Fun, versatile, well made little gaming console.
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old daughter saved up her babysitting money and purchased this on her own. I was against it at first, but then I remembered really wanting an Atari 2600 when I was her age and my parents said no. It's her money, she worked for it, I figured why not. I didn't know much about these prior to buying but now that it is in the house for a few weeks, I have to admit, I like it a lot. Portability when you need it, and then pop it in the included docking station and play it on the family TV. Fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Nintendo System since the SNES!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to beat a dead horse, but the Nintendo Switch is a Must-Have- game system. If you want to travel with high quality portable games. This is for you. If you want to "break the ice" with your social gathering friends, turn on the Switch and put on "Just Dance 2018", every one will start dancing and if you'll serving an "adult" juice, it makes the night even more memorable. And if you want the best game of 2017, Zelda: Breath of the Wild. You could only play it on this system and also the Wii U (R.I.P)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phiny

customer_reviews.title: This system is really fun, on the road or in your living room!
customer_reviews.text: I like the whole concept of playing on the TV and them moving right into a mobile setup. There are also a bunch of titles to choose from and you can access the internet to download titles at a discount price that you will not find at the game stores or on Amazon. This is my first Nintendo since the 64, so I am having a blast with Mario Kart, Zelda and Super Mario Odyssey. If you are into Nintendo or want to try something other than the Xbox and PlayStation, get one and you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Van Houtte

customer_reviews.title: Great system, good game selections
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Comfortable as handheld and the joycon controller grips are comfortable and stable. No connectivity issues either the joycons when it's set up with the TV. Fun games like Breath of the Wild (of course) and some other more indie titles like Transistor, Child of Light, and Bastion. I have all three on PC but it's really nice on the big screen and you can see the great art in even better detail and the controls are really nice and easy to use/remember. Joy con battery life is also great. Favorite Nintendo system since the good old Gamecube, including the handhelds.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Left controller showing that it's dead when it has a full charge
customer_reviews.text: The left controller keeps showing that it's dead when it is fully charged. It will stop working, and say it's not charged, then will suddenly work again and show a full charge after not charging it any more. Very frustrating given how expensive these are! The console itself is great, a ton of fun to play. However, having the left controller malfunction really ruins the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Arend

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate gaming console. Period.
customer_reviews.text: This is, without a doubt, my favorite console ever. I've played many over the decades & I can't believe the weird is just now getting this wonderful device. Play on your tv by docking it, then pick up where you left off wherever you are, as a handheld. IT'S THE PERFECT SYSTEM FOR BUSY ADULTS who simply don't have the time to be there to a TV for hours anymore, playing their favorite videogames. Take them with you now, where you left off, anytime & anyplace. And mind you, these are full-on, powerful games. They aren't watered down at all by being played in handheld mode, either. And the game library is MASSIVE. This is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Navarro, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best since the N64
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo did something new and special with this console. It is well built and has a fantastic design. The controls while very different are easy and almost natural to use. It links up to TVs through the dock easily but has excellent graphics on its own. Plus Nintendo has some great games for this. I haven't bothered buying a console in years, but I'm super happy that I purchased this one. I'm looking forward to what titles Nintendo adds to the already solid lineup and how they'll make sure of the switch's great capabilities. My only recommendation is that you get a microSD card so you don't have to worry about internal memory.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo is Back and Better than Ever
customer_reviews.text: The Nintendo Switch might just be my favorite video game console of all time. So many fun games. You can play it on the go, or on your TV, and it's seamless. It might not be as "powerful" as the PlayStations and Xboxes of the world, but it's gorgeous. The only negative I really have about it is the online service isn't great. Games I recommend picking up for it: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Super Mario Odyssey, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible controllers
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE the switch and its games but the controllers are AWFUL. They have a mind of their own. Currently submitted the issue to Nintendo and waiting to hear their resolution. May update the review if they resolve this. 5 stars if they can fix the remotes. I am NOT buying another pair of $80 controllers for what is obviously a design or manufacturing flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie A 28

customer_reviews.title: What's nice about the Joycons is you can just leave them ...
customer_reviews.text: Truly a revolutionary console. I can't get enough of Breath of the Wild. What's nice about the Joycons is you can just leave them out of the grip and relax your shoulders while you play. If you're on a couch, lounge chair or equivalent, you can sit back, relax, and play your favorite games. My only complaint is the console's somewhat lackluster battery life when played outside of the dock. The Joycons are rather small too, but I don't think it'll be too big an issue for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Wait for Stock to Stabilize - But Definitely Buy A Switch!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about how cool this consol-hybrid is. The thought never crossed my mind that I wanted to lay in bed and play Mario Kart but the Switch has shown me the way. Get a good screen protector and if you are not picky about your controllers then the Joy-cons work fine. I did pickup the Pro Controller and I feel like it is a worthy upgrade if you are looking for a competitive or proper experience. I am waiting for the free games each month (don't come out until 2018) and the virtual console store (also 2018).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Rarely in stock but amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo has always been one of my favorite companies and the Switch in their next console lineup is amazing just as it's predecessors. Although these are hard to find and there inflated priced ones everywhere this console was well worth the wait. Zelda BOTW is a must have and currently the main title worth playing on the Switch to date. If you have yet to get one don't be in to much of a rush or letdown that you can't find one since you are only really missing it for one game. Just like the PS4 and Xbox One when they launched this console is no different, it needs new titles to expand its small library.
customer_reviews.author: EdSev

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it really is a legit game console you can take with you.
customer_reviews.text: A console game machine that you can carry around? I was skeptical, but it seems to run well on our TV (55" HiDef), it looks great when they play, and they can actually take it with them, and play the same games. Sharing is a bit difficult, but the Mario Kart 8 game can play with two players, using the two joy-cons as individual controllers. The best feature? "Its portable", according to the little guy. The worst feature? "It only has 2 hours of power when its portable." We did get a car charger for it, which makes it much more usable on trips. Nintendo sells a combo charger kit that has both a car charger and a plug-in adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Besso

customer_reviews.title: Great games and continued game development, but poor connection between console and television
customer_reviews.text: Within a very short time the connection between the power cable and console begins to loosen. As a result the consul continually disconnects from the TV and games can no longer be played through the television. Pressure needs to be placed against the power cable in an attempt to keep the connection, however even this fails to work after a period of time. There needs to be a way to contact Nintendo to obtain either a new console or AC connector.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: If You're on the Fence, Buy It.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a gamer for decades and I've always gravitated towards the latest, greatest, and most powerful hardware around. Needless to say, I was hesitant to try the Nintendo Switch. I am honestly suprised how much I like it. Great for travel and the ability to switch back and forth from TV to handheld mode is extremely helpful. For the price you are really getting some decent hardware and game titles. Obviously not as much as PS4 and XBox One but it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Combat Dork

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 03/23/2017 Great consol, great games so far...buy it!! :D * * * * * * * * UPDATE * * * * * * * * * 03/27/2018 A year has passed since I have the console and it has been great!! Functionally speaking, I have not had any problem, it's still like new. The catalog of video games has increased dramatically, the great majority of great quality. My personal catalog amounts to about 20 games and I have all enjoyed them too much. This has been a great INVESTMENT and your purchase is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Claudio R

customer_reviews.title: Great system. Amazon sellers charge nearly double what it should be
customer_reviews.text: I guess if i couldnt find it elsewhere cheaper or at nintendo.com i would consider buying this waaaaaaay overpriced item. Great system for sure. Mk8deluxe is great but it needs some updating or replacing by mk9.
customer_reviews.author: dSal

customer_reviews.title: Joycons did not work upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving my Switch, I had noticed upon trying to play it, the left joycon would not move up or down. Now, after a day of owning it, the right Joycon does not click down anymore. Amazon had sent me some bum controllers, and were careless in the packaging. Word of the wise, if you begin to notice your controllers are not working, SEND this back! It it NOT worth the wasted investment!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Watson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible stand.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this product and decide to use it on the tv, be wary. Any slight touch on the stand will literally just let it fall over, just by breathing on this stand while it had the switch in it, caused it to fall over and scratch the switch. In all seriousness, the stand is absolute garbage for a stand, it literally just sucks as in just a slight touch it falls over. Not only that, the switch literally has NO way to stay in the stand, allowing the switch to just EJECT the hell out and you can't even put a screen protector on in stand mode.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley A

customer_reviews.title: Great for the games, useless for everything else.
customer_reviews.text: I basically spent $400 to play two Nintendo games. In terms of the hardware and experience, the only gripe I have is that using the joycons is painful. They feel fragile and the right stick is way too low to make the handheld experience comfortable. They did a great job making the "switching" functionality seamless, though. My major problems are this: - No messaging - No voice chat - No party options - Very limited third-party apps (I have a freaking weather app on my PS4) - Too expensive If Nintendo would improve their app marketplace to make the console a more encompassing home experience, I would increase this to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Bricked After First Use
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally play with my switch when it arrived. Everything was going well until after a couple hours of gameplay, the game froze. The screen then went orange. When I tried resetting it, the screen became stuck at the Switch logo. I was devastated to see my brand new console rendered useless. When I called Nintendo, they told me Amazon didn't register my device's serial number. Right now, my device runs for a couple hours after being left turned off for about a day. However, it can't detect any wifi networks. After running for a couple hours it eventually freezes and gets stuck on the Switch screen again. This is so upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Console and portable game system in one
customer_reviews.text: Like the combining of console and portable. Also like how others can dock their system and play on your tv. Not as happy with Nintendo adopting some of the Sony and Microsoft ideas. Need to buy online memberships to multiplay or save some games, other games have greatly reduced multiplayer. Example: Original Splatoon had split screen multiplayer, Splatoon 2 requires each player to have an entire system and copy of the game to play together. They have definitely lost some of the group/family play fun of previous systems.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: A great console - both handheld and on the tv
customer_reviews.text: Like my last Nintendo system, I thought I was going to buy the Switch, play Zelda, and then never touch it again. The indie games in the shop, though, have hooked me on the Switch. I'm obsessively burning through Banner Saga and have several other games lined up for afterwords. I played Breath of the Wild primarily on my TV and Banner Saga as a handheld. Both are great ways to play. I've been doing a lot of air travel so the Switch has been a real life saver on long flights or during long delays at the airports.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: One of the most impressive console's this generation has ever laid eyes on!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put: this console packs a punch to offer 30fps games on a portable LCD 720p screen, 1080p if docked to TV. The amount of games being offered now is obscenely high, which goes to show how much momentum this console has gained since it's release/reveal. You have great selections like Breath of the Wild (duh), Mario Odyssey (yes), Fortnite (meh), Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee! (absolutely), Dark Souls Remastered, Skyrim, Monster Hunter: Generations Ult, and of course Smash Bros. Ultimate (everyone's here BABEEEEEEEE)! For a price of $299.99, you're getting one heck of a piece of durable, reliable, and even family fun hardware that everyone can love, share and play!
customer_reviews.author: Mudda Goose

customer_reviews.title: Great console, terrible controllers.
customer_reviews.text: The Switch itself is great, if a little underpowered. The Joycon controllers, however, are really unreliable. When playing in handheld mode, they generally work fine, but docked, they disconnect frequently and the controls get stuck. This seems to be a universal issue with all Joycons as I’ve tested several different sets since the Switch first launched, and all of them suffer from the same issues, with varying reliability. The Pro controller is generally much more reliable, so I highly recommend getting one if you plan on playing with your Switch docked.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Glad to see Nintendo doing well again
customer_reviews.text: Glad to see Nintendo doing well again. This console is excellent. The ability to instantly "switch" between handheld and a TV is such a great feature. I recommend buying a usb C cable to charge while on the go. With that big screen the battery will only last a few hours. There really should have been one included in the box. Tip: don't slide the controllers on backwards. If you do, make sure the remotes are unlocked before you try taking them back off.
customer_reviews.author: SW Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming system!
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo's new console is a hybrid meaning you can play it docked and connected to the TV or use it as a portable gaming device, this alone is a complete game changer (no pun intended). Has a standard USB C charger, storage can be expanded with a micro SD card and the game cards/cartridges are small and very convenient. The game selection is quite good with high quality Nintendo games like Mario Kart, Smash Bros. and Zelda Breath of the Wild. It fixes most of what was wrong with the Wii U.

One thing I am really going to suggest here is instead of the Pro Controller get a few USB adapters for old controllers. customer_reviews.title: Give the gift of Nintendo this year!!
customer_reviews.text: People like me who grew up in the late 80's and early 90's grew up on video games. I still remember the feels, the disbelief, and most of all, the joy of owning a game system of my own. Fast forward 29 years to Christmas 2018 and I'm in a position to give 2 of Nintendo's latest hand-held offerings to my son and nephew respectively. I have not tried this out yet for myself but the joy it will bring to my kids is for me, a 5 star experience.

product_meta.title: Nintendo Switch – Neon Red and Neon Blue Joy-Con - HAC 001 (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:Console| Color:Neon Blue and Red

Introducing Nintendo Switch, the new home video game system from Nintendo. In addition to providing single and multiplayer thrills at home, the Nintendo Switch system can be taken on the go so players can enjoy a full home console experience anytime, anywhere. The mobility of a handheld is now added to the power of a home gaming system, with unprecedented new play styles brought to life by the two new Joy-Con controllers.

PLAY ANYWHERE

Home Gaming System

At home the main unit rests in the Nintendo Switch dock, which connects the system to the TV and lets you play with family and friends in the comfort of your living room.

On-the-Go

Lift Nintendo Switch from the dock and instantly transition to handheld mode for on-the-go gaming. By sharing Joy-Con, players can go head-to-head while away from home. You can also enjoy the same great games in tabletop mode by using the included stand to prop the system up.

New Play Styles

Remove the detachable Joy-Con from either side of Nintendo Switch for more play styles:

 * One player can use a Joy-Con in each hand
 * Two players can each take one
 * Multiple Joy-Con can be employed by numerous people for a variety of gameplay options (additional Joy-Con sold separately)
 * Slip a set of Joy-Con into a Joy-Con grip accessory, mirroring a more traditional controller. Or, select an optional Nintendo Switch Pro Controller.

Bring together up to 8 Nintendo Switch systems for local face-to-face multiplayer.

 Parental Controls 

Keep the focus on fun by using parental controls to manage how your family interacts with Nintendo Switch.

You can manage Nintendo eShop purchases via your Nintendo Account. You may also limit sharing on social networks, restrict access to games based on their ESRB ratings, and more. A free app gives you even more choices and a handy way to manage your Nintendo Switch parental controls from anywhere via your mobile device.



SET CONTAINS:
Console, Neon Blue Joy-Con (L) and Neon Red Joy-Con (R) controllers
Joy-Con grip (to which two Joy-Con are attached and used as one controller)
Set of Joy-Con Controller Straps (Black)
Nintendo Switch dock (which holds the main console and connects it to a TV)
HDMI cable
AC adapter
feature_bullets: Play your way with the Nintendo Switch gaming system. Whether you’re at home or on the go, solo or with friends, the Nintendo Switch system is designed to fit your life. Dock your Nintendo Switch to enjoy HD gaming on your TV. Heading out? Just undock your console and keep playing in handheld mode
Level up your character and yourself
